comments: Fernando (ATL) brings his hand toward Mann (CHA) and marginal contact occurs as Fernando releases away to roll.
Mann (CHA) goes to, not through, Forrest's (ATL) space as he releases the pass and marginal contact occurs as the two come together at the end of the drive.
Miller (CHA) initiates contact with Forrest's (ATL) right arm, which alters his driving shot attempt.
Fernando (ATL) makes contact with Miller's (CHA) left arm, which affects his driving shot attempt.
Mann (CHA) is attempting to deflect the pass and marginal contact occurs with Fernando's (ATL) body.
Williams (CHA) maintains verticality and absorbs the contact that occurs during Fernando's (ATL) layup attempt.

Bufkin's (ATL) hand brushes Bridges' (CHA) head while contesting the driving shot attempt and the contact is marginal. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Windler (ATL) releases the in-bounds pass within 5 seconds.
Bufkin (ATL) grasps and then quickly releases Williams' (CHA) jersey off-ball.
Bridges (CHA) closes out toward Forrest (ATL) and marginal body contact occurs as Forrest attempts to pass the ball.
